Utils runner¶

La gestion des dates est exclusivement faite en naive à savoir utilisation de datetime python.

Celery utilisant UTC (des aware timezone), j’ai patché django-celery pour l’utilisation des naives datetime.

Author: Philippe ‘paHpa’ Vivien <philippe.vivien@nerim.com>

Copyright: Nerim, 2014

runner.utils.date.datenow()¶

return now() with timezone aware from TZ setting or datetime

runner.utils.date.dt2ts(dt)¶

DateTime To TimeStamp

runner.utils.date.ts2dt(ts, timeplus=0)¶

TimeStamp To DateTime

Author: Philippe ‘paHpa’ Vivien <philippe.vivien@nerim.com>

Copyright: Nerim, 2014

runner.utils.logger.logdebug()¶

set debug logger

runner.utils.logger.loginfo()¶

set info logger

Author: Michal Danilák Mimino666 Author: Philippe ‘paHpa’ Vivien <philippe.vivien@nerim.com>

runner.utils.autoregister.autoregister_admin(module, exclude_models=None, model_fields=None, exclude_fields=None, admin_fields=None, reversed_relations=None, ModelAdmin=<class 'django.contrib.admin.options.ModelAdmin'>)¶

@param module: module containing django.db.models classes @type module: str or __module__

If you are providing str, use absolute path.

@param exclude_models: list of models to exclude from auto-register @type exclude_models: iterable of strings or None

@param model_fields: dictionary of additional fields for list_display
{model_name: [field_name1, field_name2, ...]}

@type model_fields: dict or None

@param exclude_fields: dictionary of fields to exclude from the models
{model_name: [field_name1, field_name2, ...]}

@type exclude_fields: dict or None

@param admin_fields: dictionary of additional admin fields
{model_name: {admin_field_name: value, ...}}

@type admin_fields: dict or None

@param reversed_relations: dictionary of additional reversed m2m/fk
relations to include to admin

{model_name: [relation_name1, relation_name2, ...]}

@type reversed_relations: dict or None

Author: Philippe ‘paHpa’ Vivien <philippe.vivien@nerim.com>

Copyright: Nerim, 2014
